metadata.title: Interesting AI/ML Articles On Medium This Week (Nov 22) | by Richmond Alake | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Interesting AI/ML Articles On Medium This Week (Nov 22)
metadata.description: The number of well written AI/ML/DS articles on Medium is always increasing, and sometimes only the articles that are pushed by the Medium algorithm make it to our feed, emails and recommendations…

all_paragraphs: The number of well written AI/ML/DS articles on Medium is always increasing, and sometimes only the articles that are pushed by the Medium algorithm make it to our feed, emails and recommendations.
That’s why every week I compile a list of impressive AI-focused article that might have flown under your radar.
Articles I’ve included in this recommended list are written with ML practitioners in mind.
Subject areas the articles cover are gender imbalance within data science; learning from a two year DS work experience; Apple’s M1 processor and its impact on machine learning and many more.
Arnuld’s article is a recollection of ten obstacles encountered during his learning journey. Each obstacle included is supplemented with the methods Arnuld leverage to overcome the obstacle.

Intermediate to seasoned Machine learning practitioners will be familiar with the obstacles included in this article; for example, the illusion of achievable perfectionism, the need to learn it all, ambiguous roles and job descriptions.
One creative and unique aspect of this article is the accumulation of the estimated time Arnuld has taken to overcome each obstacle.
At the end of the article, you are presented with a surprising estimation as to the time each obstacle has taken away from Arnuld.
Nicole, a Federal Data Science Consultant, shares ways to avoid common pitfalls within the Data Science planning process, all from her experience as a Data Scientist.

Implementing Nicole’s pitfall avoidance tips and advice can essentially streamline the planning process within DS projects and create an environment aimed at the delivery of efficient, useful and quality data science models or applications.
This article also includes illustrations and external resources that provide users with additional insights and information into the included corresponding pitfall avoidance strategies.
Target Audience: Machine Learning Practitioners (Hardware Interests)
Tommy Shrove provides machine learning relevant information on the newly introduced M1 processor by Apple.

Machine learning processes and implementation are tied closely with computational hardware resources, and within this article provides information on the details of components within the M1 processor and how they impact machine learning processes.
Tommy provides information on the performance and efficiency of the components, which are then translated into their benefits in a practical scenario involving machine learning processes.

Tommy also mentions how the M1 processor is expected to perform with a suite of conventional machine learning tools and applications commonly utilised by ML practitioners, for example, VS Code, Jupyter etc.
Natassha explores the lack of females within Data Science roles and more broadly, STEM fields.
Natassha article attributes the small number of women in tech to several causes, one of which is the mindset that women are raised with from an adolescent age.
Not only does this article identifies and explores the problem (lack of women in tech), Natassha also touches on possible solutions that can level the playing field in the coming years.

This article is worth reading as I believe it opens up the chance to have a dialogue around the unbalanced environment within tech. We all have a role to play to create an opportunity for equal representation.
Arunn has written an article that shares a wealth of knowledge and learnings from his two years of experience working as a Machine Learning Engineer within an AI Startup.

This article is one that I would highly recommend to entry-level Data Scientists or ML practitioners. Arunn includes some crucial tips and advice that can aid overwhelmed entry-level ML practitioners, ease into an AI-focused work environment.

The advice Arunn mentions in this article is associated with topics such as growth mindset, teamwork, responsibility management and many more advice that will set a strong foundation for any ML practitioner looking to have a long and stable career within the AI field.
To connect with me or find more content similar to this article, do the following:
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
Machine Learning Content Creator with 1M+ views— Computer Vision Engineer. Interested in gaining and sharing knowledge on Technology and Finance
